title: How to Make Leg Warmers from Old Sweaters

steps.headline: Decide how long you want your leg warmers to be.
steps.description: In this example, the warmers are as long as the sleeves are. Cut the sleeves off at the desired length.

steps.headline: Turn the sleeves inside out and try them on to see how they fit.
steps.description: They'll probably be a little baggy. The following steps are for tightening the leg warmers, if you need to or want to (some people like them baggy).

steps.headline: Find the seam and pull the extra fabric together.
steps.description: Pull it as tight as you need, then pin the excess fabric together. This is where the new seam will be, so try to be as precise as possible.

steps.headline: Create a path using fabric chalk.
steps.description: Use the pins as a guide for your path; this is where you'll be sewing.

steps.headline: Sew the fabric along the path you created in the previous steps.
Try them on to make sure they fit the way you want them to.
steps.description: Be sure to turn them right-side out before hand.

steps.headline: Turn them inside out again and cut off the fabric just outside of the stitching if you're happy with the fit.
steps.description: If not, pull out the thread and fit the leg warmers again.
